node.title: After a three-year battle, the WTO has ruled in favour of Australian cane farmers â€” so what does it mean now?
node.alt: A man holding a single, tall stalk of sugar cane stands in a recently harvested field.
node.description: Half a world away from Australia's cane fields, a decision has been made that will affect farmers across the country.
node.content:
["Greg Plath stepped out of university and\u00a0onto a tractor in 1981, the latest in his family's long\u00a0line of cane farmers.", "His days are spent in the paddock, planting, growing and managing the crop until the tall, tropical grass is cut down by a harvester and transported to mills via train to be crushed\u00a0into something recognisable to put with your tea or coffee.\u00a0", "The daily grind was particularly tough for the five years that the global price of sugar was so low it barely covered the cost of production.\u00a0", "\"All you do when those things happen is watch your costs very closely, and match them as close as you can to your income,\" Mr Plath said.\u00a0", "\"You make your tractors last a few more years, you do things yourself, you work longer hours so you don't have to employ anyone full time, you just watch your costs and cut your costs when you can.\"\u00a0", "But after several long years, a decision made a world away from Queensland cane fields, in Geneva, Switzerland, should make life easier for farmers like Greg Plath.\u00a0", "", "
Cane farmers have dealt with low prices for the past decade, but they are now higher than they have seen for a while- and hoped to rise further.\u00a0(ABC Rural: Melanie Groves)
", "The World Trade Organization (WTO) decided in favour of the Australian government, which argued India's export subsidies were distorting the global market price of sugar.\u00a0", "The WTO ruled that\u00a0for five consecutive sugar seasons\u00a0India's domestic price support was in excess of the permitted level.\u00a0", "The news comes three years after Australia first lodged the\u00a0complaint with\u00a0the WTO\u00a0where it claimed India's subsidies caused a glut on the international market and led to a significant drop in global prices.\u00a0", "
Just what will this mean for farmers and consumers?\u00a0
", "Chairman of Canegrowers, Paul Schembri is elated by the government's win.\u00a0", "He said the global market should take this ruling into account, which he hoped would\u00a0lead to a rise in prices.\u00a0", "While it had\u00a0taken three long years to reach this point, he also knew it was not the end.\u00a0", "\"I need to stress, there are still appeals processes that need to be worked through,\" Mr Schembri said.", "", "
During harvest season, cane locos and bins\u00a0of sugar cane is a common sight as it's hauled to mills across coastal Queensland to be crushed.\u00a0(ABC Rural: Melanie Groves)
", "Commodities analyst Tom McNeill said the impact on consumers would be limited.\u00a0", "\"Sugar in its raw form is only a very small component of a final product on the supermarket shelf, it may only count for 1 to 2 per cent,\" Mr McNeill said.\u00a0", "\"But over the long period, producers would be guaranteed a better price to sell.\"", "
A billion dollars worth of damage
", "Years of low global sugar prices has an impact on more than just Australian cane farmers.\u00a0", "An independent report by Green Pool Commodity Specialists, commissioned by the Australian Sugar Milling Council (ASMC), concluded that India's subsidised exports contributed to substantially lower global sugar prices.\u00a0", "The report found Queensland cane growers and sugar millers \"had incurred an estimated $1 billion revenue hit between 2017/18 and 2020/21 \u2014\u00a0or almost $5 million every week\".", "", "
Cane growers have been waiting three years to see results of the World Trade Organisation complaint.\u00a0(ABC Rural: Tom Major)
", "The Green Pool report also stated:", "The director of Economics, Policy and Trade for the Australian Sugar Milling\u00a0Council, David Rynne, said the low sugar prices caused by India's subsidies were one of the factors leading to the closure of two Queensland sugar mills within the past few years.\u00a0", "", "
Two sugar mills have closed in Queensland over the past few years.\u00a0(ABC Rural: David Sparkes\u00a0)
", "\"We've had one mill close in Maryborough and one mill closure\u00a0in Bundaberg,\" Mr Rynne said.", "\"And that's because prices have been low, profits have been low, and our yields and volumes through the mills are poor.", "
'Supreme optimists'
", "Cane grower Greg Plath said years of bad prices were tough\u00a0and low prices due to Indian subsidies was just one time since he took over the family business that they had dipped.\u00a0", "But ultimately, he knew the global market would eventually recover.\u00a0", "", "
Greg Plath said farmers are universally optimistic, and while times were tough when prices were low, the hoped they'd soon turn around.\u00a0(ABC Rural: Melanie Groves)
", "\"Farmers are supreme optimists,\" Mr Plath said.\u00a0", "\"You hope rain comes at the right time, you hope you don't get any pests and diseases, you hope the varieties you grow are good.", "The price of raw sugar had already risen to the best price in years, prior to the WTO making this decision, but Paul Schembri said the decision by the WTO was more than symbolic.\u00a0", "\"It's more important than that, [a symbolic act]\" Mr Schembri said.\u00a0", "\"One of the factors that has driven up the current strong world sugar prices has been the fact that in the last six months\u00a0India\u00a0decided not to implement another round of export subsidies.\"\u00a0", "The WTO panel has recommended India withdraw the subsidies within 120 days from the adoption of the report by the WTO Dispute Settlement Body.\u00a0", "India has the right to appeal the decision to the WTO Appellate Body.\u00a0"]
